CONSUMERS CO-OP ASSN.
1025 EAST FRONAGE ROAD
LITCHFIELD MN 55355

FOR FURTHER INFORMATION ,CONTACT CRAIG BULAU PLANT MANGER 320-693-6014

RISK MANAGEMENT PLAN EXTECUTIVE SUMMARY
1. THE FACILITY POLICY
The owner ,management and employees of Consumers Co-op Assn. Are commited to the prevention of any accidental release
of anhydrous and propane . If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire company, or other authorities, to mitigate any minimize the impact of the release to people and the enviroment.

2 FACILITY INFORMATION
 The primary activity at the facility is the storage and blending of fertilizer for the sale to farmers, and propane sales and delivery.Anhydrous ammoina is received , store and distributes for direct application . Anhydrous ammoina is used for the crop production nutrients . Propane gas is received, stored and distributed for delivery forhome heating, farm and commerical business uses.
The maximum quanity of ammonia stored would be 400,000 pounds in our 26,000 storage tanks.The maxium quantity handled would be the unloading of a tank truck holdin 40,000 pounds.
The maxium quantity of propane gas stored would be 220,000 pounds in our two 30,000 gallon storage tanks. The maximum quantity handled would be the unloading of a tank truck of holding 40,000 pounds.

3 The worest-case release scenario and the alternative releasescenario .
 A. The worest-case release scenario for anhydrous ammiona would be the release of the contnts of a storage tank released as a gas over ten minutes . The maxium quanitity released would br 120,000 pounds , which represents the volume of the storage tank at 85 percent capacity as limited by design standards . Th edistance the end point (point of dispersion to 200ppm) is 1.09 miles.
He worset case release scenario for propanewould be the failure of one 30,000 gallon storage tank when filled to 85 percent capacity (150,000 pounds) resulting in a vapor cloud explosion causing a 1

psi overpressure . According to EPA lookup tables, the distance to the endpoint is .43 miles.
B. The alternative release scenario for anhydrous ammonia based on the hazard review is a 2 minute release from a break in a 3 inch pipe . The distance to the endpoint(point of dispersion to 200 ppm) is .78 miles .
 The alternative release scenario for propane would be the failure of one 30,000 gallons storage tank when filled to 85 percent capacity (150,000 pounds) resulting in two-thirds of a vapor cloud explosion causing a 1 psi overpressure . According to EPA lookup tables , the distance to the endpoint is (factor of .67 x.43 miles = .29 miles) .29 miles .
4 . The accidetal release prevation program.
He facility has implemented the provision of "Safety Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Anhydrous , K61.1" , published by the American National Standard Institute , Inc. and the Standard of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Adminstration (OSHA) , 29 CFR 1919.111, " Storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia". In addition, Minnesota Dept. Ag Rules . For prpane , NFPA-58 rules>
5 The Five - year Accident History.
A. There have been no accidetal release of anhydrous ammoina or propane in the past 5 years that have caused any death , injuries, or significant property damage at the facility.
6 The emergency response program
 The facility has: 
a . A written emergency action plan , I accordance with OSHA standards ,29 CFR 1910.38
b. Provided state and local authoritites the emergency planning and community right to know information as required under SARA TITLE III (EPCRA) .
C. Coordinated with local emergency responders.
